articles.author: Timour Azhari, Muhammad Gebaly
articles.description: Israel and Lebanon exchanged heavy fire into Sunday, with Israeli warplanes carrying out the most intense bombardment in almost a year of war across Lebanon's south, while Hezbollah claimed rocket attacks on military targets in Israel's north.
articles.title: Hezbollah, Israel exchange heavy fire after deadly Israeli strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sri Lanka's Marxist-leaning leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake grabbed a commanding early lead on Sunday in his bid to become the next president of the debt-ridden country seeking to elect a leader to bolster its fragile economic recovery.
articles.title: Sri Lanka's Marxist-leaning Dissanayake in early lead to become president

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly adopted a "Pact for the Future" on Sunday, which U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres described as a landmark agreement that is a "step-change towards more effective, inclusive, networked multilateralism."
articles.title: UN adopts pact that aims to save global cooperation

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The AfD became the first far-right party to win a state election in Germany since World War Two, in Thuringia.
articles.title: Germany's far-right AfD on track for another state election win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gas explosion in a coal mine in Iran's South Khorasan Province killed at least 31 people and injured 16, the country's interior minister Eskandar Momeni told state media on Sunday.
articles.title: At least 31 dead in Iran coal mine blast

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: Ecuador's government has announced the suspension of electricity service for nine hours on Sunday in 12 of the Andean nation's 24 provinces and placed 19 areas on red alert due to a drought that has reduced the water levels of hydroelectric plants.
articles.title: Ecuador cuts power in half of its provinces amid historic drought

articles.author: Tarek Amara
articles.description: Hundreds of Tunisians protested on Sunday against President Kais Saied, accusing him of deepening authoritarian rule and stifling political competition two weeks before a presidential election.
articles.title: Tunisians resume protests against president ahead of Oct. 6 election

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed seven people in a school sheltering displaced families in Gaza City on Sunday, Palestinian health officials said, with the Israeli military saying it had targeted militants operating from the compound.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills seven in Gaza school compound, Palestinian medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis on Sunday condemned the killing last week of an environmental activist in Honduras who had protested over mining and hydro-electric projects to try to protect tropical forests and rivers.
articles.title: Pope condemns killing of Honduran environmental activist

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces struck a multi-storey apartment building in Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv, on Saturday evening, wounding 21 people and prompting an evacuation of some of its residents, Mayor Ihor Terekhov said.
articles.title: Russian strike on apartment block in Kharkiv injures 21
